content:
The forest moon colony has implemented strict regulations prohibiting the use of fossil fuels and combustion engines to protect its pristine environment and promote sustainable practices. This decision was made to prevent air pollution, minimize greenhouse gas emissions, and preserve the unique ecosystems on the moon.

As a result, all vehicles, machinery, and equipment on the forest moon rely on alternative energy sources and technologies, such as electric motors, fuel cells, and gravity-based systems. This has led to the development and widespread use of advanced, eco-friendly vehicles like the FHLT, FMLT, and grav bikes. In addition, the colony has adopted clean energy sources like solar, geothermal, and possibly wind or other renewable energies for its power needs.

The strict ban on fossil fuels and combustion engines has made the forest moon a model for sustainable living and environmental stewardship, showcasing the possibilities of a cleaner, greener future for other planets and civilizations to follow.
